    Common Inventory Use Cases

    inventory_example.Rmd

    This vignette covers several common forest inventory use cases that can be covered by allometric

    Making Predictions of a Variable for Multiple Species

    This vignette demonstrates a simple forest inventory example using allometric using plot data obtained from the Forest Inventory and Analysis (FIA) program. The objective of the analysis is to estimate the mean cubic volume of trees in Jackson County, Oregon.

    library(allometric)
    ## 
## Attaching package: 'allometric'
    ## The following object is masked from 'package:stats':
## 
##     predict
    library(dplyr)
    ## 
## Attaching package: 'dplyr'
    ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
## 
##     filter, lag
    ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
## 
##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
    library(purrr)
library(tibble)

target_species <- tibble(
  genus = c('Alnus', 'Pseudotsuga'),
  species = c('rubra', 'menziesii')
)

mods <- allometric_models %>%
  filter(
    component == 'stem',
    measure == 'volume',
    map_lgl(region, ~ 'US-OR' %in% .),
    map_lgl(covt_name, ~ all(c('dsob', 'hst') %in% .) & length(.) == 2)) %>%
  right_join(target_species) %>%
  filter(pub_id == "poudel_2019") %>%
  select(genus, species, model)
    ## Joining, by = c("genus", "species")
    n <- 1000000

trees <- tibble(
  hst = rnorm(n, 40, 3),
  dsob = rnorm(n, 50, 2),
  genus = c(rep('Alnus', n/2), rep('Pseudotsuga', n/2))
)

merge(trees, mods) %>% as_tibble() %>%
  mutate(vol = predict(model[[1]], dsob, hst))
    ## # A tibble: 1,000,000 Ã— 6
##    genus   hst  dsob species model        vol
##    <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>   <list>     <dbl>
##  1 Alnus  41.3  50.9 rubra   <FxdEffcM>  3.42
##  2 Alnus  43.4  50.2 rubra   <FxdEffcM>  3.48
##  3 Alnus  37.2  43.7 rubra   <FxdEffcM>  2.27
##  4 Alnus  42.8  48.8 rubra   <FxdEffcM>  3.24
##  5 Alnus  39.3  49.2 rubra   <FxdEffcM>  3.05
##  6 Alnus  41.4  46.2 rubra   <FxdEffcM>  2.80
##  7 Alnus  43.2  51.3 rubra   <FxdEffcM>  3.62
##  8 Alnus  42.4  49.5 rubra   <FxdEffcM>  3.30
##  9 Alnus  38.8  48.2 rubra   <FxdEffcM>  2.88
## 10 Alnus  42.8  49.6 rubra   <FxdEffcM>  3.34
## # â€¦ with 999,990 more rows

    Storing an Internal Set of Equations for Routine Use

    It is unlikely that most organizations need all models stored in allometric_models for routine use. For example, the Forest Inventory and Analysis (FIA) program has specified sets of allometric models over the years that are used to produce cubic volumes and biomasses for the national FIA database [cite]. Subsets of the allometric_models table can be prepared by analysts and stored locally as RDS files, which can then be used in routine analysis.
